DEFRA 2024 international aviation long-haul passenger emission factor (0.19 kgCO2e/pkm) including well-to-tank uplift; bounds span published high/low radiative forcing uplift scenarios.
IEA business aviation analysis citing 0.6–1.2 kgCO2e/pkm for typical corporate jet missions; midpoint retained at 0.9 kgCO2e/pkm for planning use.
ICAO CORSIA default life-cycle intensity for short-haul (<1,500 km) jet operations rounded to 0.25 kgCO2e/pkm with ±20% bounds reflecting narrow-body fleet efficiency variations.

Claude estimated footprint per 1k tokens following SRC.LUCCIONI.2023 with 180–350 gCO2e low/high span covering datacentre mix effects.
Google inference on carbon-optimized TPUs, per 1k tokens, with 150–300 gCO2e range reflecting SRC.LUCCIONI.2023 uncertainty and TPU efficiency variation.
~280 gCO2e per 1k GPT tokens (cloud, mixed datacentre regions) with 200–400 gCO2e sensitivity bounds drawn from SRC.LUCCIONI.2023 scenario sweep.
ICAO CORSIA CERT methodology gives ~0.5 kgCO2e per tonne-km for medium-haul dedicated cargo jets; ±30% bounds cover aircraft efficiency and load factors.
EPA SmartWay technical documentation cites ~0.5 kgCO2e per urban delivery stop; assuming 1.2 parcels per stop and NRCan fleet blend yields ≈0.40 kgCO2e per parcel with ±25% bounds for route density.
Representative dry bulk shipping intensity blending IMO 2020 averages with ICCT 2023 well-to-wake adjustments.
Tank-to-wake plus upstream fuel intensity for container shipping harmonising IMO 2020 fleet data with ICCT 2023 updates.
NRCan modal freight emissions factors indicate Canadian heavy-duty trucks emit roughly 0.06 kgCO2e per tonne-km; ±20% bounds reflect payload and backhaul variation.
GCCA GNR dataset reports 2022 kiln emissions of 0.85 tCO2e/t clinker across Canadian facilities (0.80–0.90 tCO2e/t range).
PlasticsEurope cradle-to-gate LCI cites 2.7 tCO2e/t virgin PET pellets (2.4–3.0 tCO2e/t reflecting energy mix uncertainty).
worldsteel integrated route indicators show ~2.0 tCO2e/t crude steel slabs with 1.8–2.2 tCO2e/t variation by fuel mix.
Median cradle-to-grave intensity for beef from Poore & Nemecek (2018) of 60 kgCO2e/kg applied to a 150 g cooked portion; lower and upper quartiles (36–82 kgCO2e/kg) set bounds.
Median poultry meat intensity of 6 kgCO2e/kg applied to a 150 g cooked portion; quartile range (4–7 kgCO2e/kg) sets bounds.
Median legumes/pulses intensity of 2 kgCO2e/kg applied to a 150 g cooked portion; quartile range (1.2–3.2 kgCO2e/kg) sets bounds.

EPA WARM v15 mixed MSW combustion for energy recovery reports ~0.267 MTCO2e per short ton; converted to 295 gCO2e/kg assuming 907.185 kg per short ton and retaining ±35% bounds for facility energy offsets.
EPA WARM v15 mixed MSW landfilling (national average LFG recovery, typical collection) gives 0.438 MTCO2e per short ton disposed; converted to 482.8 gCO2e/kg using 907.185 kg per short ton.
Toronto Water 2023 annual report cites ≈72 kt CO2e scope 1+2 emissions over ~0.40 billion m³ supplied; intensity rounded to 0.18 kgCO2e/m³ with ±30% bounds for year-to-year energy mix swings.

Surface ocean pH decline per decade reflecting acidification feedback.
NOAA GOS carbon budget midpoint; negative indicates sink strength.

HD video call per participant-hour using DIMPACT device mix and Ontario grid linkage.

ACX006 offline seed using provisional intensity pending dataset sync.
Ontario TV streaming hour with DIMPACT playback power, network, and data-centre shares.
Mobile social scrolling electricity from DIMPACT handset load aligned to Ontario grid.
Pan-Arctic thaw emissions aggregated as Pg CO₂e per year.
Combines 1,200 kWh/year AC electricity on Ontario grid (≈33.6 kgCO2e) with 6% annual leakage of a 1.5 kg R410A charge (~366 kgCO2e) from IEA Cool Coalition 2024 operational benchmarks.
UNEP TEAP 2023 split/central AC embodied intensity including compressor, coil, and cabinet manufacturing plus 1.5 kg R410A initial fill at AR6 GWP.
FAO/IEA 2024 supermarket cold-chain study: 12 kWh/kg-food-year Ontario electricity (≈336 gCO2e) plus 8% annual leakage of 0.02 kg R448A per kg throughput (~164 gCO2e).
Assumes 600 kWh/year refrigerator electricity on the Ontario grid (16.8 kgCO2e) with 10% leakage of a 0.6 kg HFC-134a charge (≈128 kgCO2e) per IEA 2024 cooling efficiency guidance and AR6 GWP.
WRAP 2023 household appliance factor covering steel, plastics, and foam manufacturing plus a 0.6 kg HFC-134a factory charge using AR6 GWP.
Aggregate proxy for N₂O/CH₄ feedback and lost sink services per km²-year.
Two-to-three vehicle armoured convoy midpoint assuming blended urban/suburban patrol duty cycle.
Guard post electricity, equipment, and vehicle standby emissions per staffed hour for Canadian luxury estates.
Jet fuel midpoint for light security helicopters operating perimeter sweeps.
Hintemann & Hinterholzer Facebook estimate (0.06 kgCO2e/hr) tuned with SRC.META.SR.2023 operational efficiency disclosures and SRC.IEA.DIGITAL.NETWORKS.2023 network/data-centre intensity ranges.

Instagram hour derived from SRC.HINTEMANN2022 mobile-focused scenario with 70% smartphone, 20% tablet, 10% desktop device mix anchored to SRC.META.SR.2023 efficiency improvements and SRC.IEA.DIGITAL.NETWORKS.2023 bandwidth intensity; ±40% bounds (50–150 gCO2e/hr) follow SRC.MALMODIN.2018.
LinkedIn browsing intensity (0.05 kgCO2e/hr) via SRC.HINTEMANN2022 knowledge-worker profile, cross-checked with SRC.MALMODIN.2018 ICT footprint ratios and SRC.IEA.DIGITAL.NETWORKS.2023 network data.

Snapchat hour from SRC.HINTEMANN2022 handset-intensive scenario, adjusted with SRC.META.SR.2023 infrastructure efficiency and SRC.IEA.DIGITAL.NETWORKS.2023 bandwidth ranges; ±40% uncertainty from SRC.MALMODIN.2018.

TikTok per-hour footprint (0.15 kgCO2e/hr) from SRC.HINTEMANN2022 short-video profile using 85% smartphone, 10% tablet, 5% desktop usage mix with network intensity anchored to SRC.IEA.DIGITAL.NETWORKS.2023 and expanded bounds (80–250 gCO2e/hr) reflecting SRC.MALMODIN.2018 variability.
Twitter/X browsing electricity (0.055 kgCO2e/hr) per SRC.HINTEMANN2022, validated against SRC.IEA.DIGITAL.NETWORKS.2023 network/device ranges and broader ICT intensity bounds from SRC.MALMODIN.2018.

Hintemann & Hinterholzer social platform intensity (~0.23 kgCO2e/hr) aligned with Ontario grid, using blended device mix of 40% smart TV, 35% smartphone, 25% laptop informed by SRC.IEA.DIGITAL.NETWORKS.2023 traffic data and SRC.GOOGLE.SR.2023 efficiency disclosures; bounds (150–400 gCO2e/hr) reflect SRC.MALMODIN.2018 ICT variability.

Ontario-weighted mix: 60% TV, 30% laptop, 10% smartphone using playback power ranges in SRC.PIHKOLA.2020; HD bitrate 2.5 GB/h (1.5–4) from SRC.DIMPACT.STREAMING.2022; network intensity 0.018 kWh/GB (0.01–0.03) from SRC.ASLAN.2018; data-centre energy 0.005 kWh/GB (0.003–0.008) assuming PUE 1.2 aligned with SRC.MASANET.2020; combined with 2024 Ontario grid 28 g/kWh (SRC.IESO.POWERDATA.2025).

Ontario-weighted mix: 60% TV, 30% laptop, 10% smartphone with playback power ranges from SRC.PIHKOLA.2020; UHD bitrate 7 GB/h (5–11) from SRC.DIMPACT.STREAMING.2022; network intensity 0.018 kWh/GB (0.01–0.03) from SRC.ASLAN.2018; data-centre energy 0.005 kWh/GB (0.003–0.008) assuming PUE 1.2 aligned with SRC.MASANET.2020; Ontario grid factor 28 g/kWh (SRC.IESO.POWERDATA.2025).
Representative CH₄/CO₂e release per tailings degassing upset.
Area-normalised CH₄/CO₂e emission factor for Alberta tailings ponds.

Diesel CO2e intensity computed with MOVES3 class-6 single-unit urban fuel economy of 7.4 mpg from SRC.EPA.MOVES.HDV.2021 and EPA GHGI tailpipe factors (10.21 kgCO2/gal plus CH4 and N2O) from SRC.EPA.GHGI.2023; ±10% bounds capture route variability.
ICCT field deployments of medium-duty urban electric trucks reported 2.1 kWh/mi (≈1.3 kWh/km) with ±15% spread across routes; applied to the corporate delivery scenario for comparison.
Converted 2017 TTC diesel consumption using UK 2023 mineral diesel factor and divided by bus passenger-kilometres estimated from boardings; ±10% passenger-kilometre assumption captured in bounds.

Derived from CUTA/MTO 2017 modal statistics allocating 85% of system electricity to heavy rail by revenue vehicle-kilometres and applying a 0.170 kWh/passenger-km intensity (0.136–0.222 kWh) with 2024 IESO grid intensity; passenger-kilometre share ±10% and 75–100% electricity allocation retained in bounds.
IESO reported 2024 Ontario grid mix intensity for system electricity.
